text: Tobias "Tobi" Delbrück (often written Delbruck) (born 1960, Pasadena, California)Faculty page at ETH Zürich is an American neuromorphic engineer at the University of Zurich and ETH Zurich, Switzerland. He was named Fellow of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) in 2014 "for contributions to neuromorphic visual sensors and processing". ==Family and education== Tobi is the son of Mary Adeline Bruce and Max Delbrück, the 1969 Nobel laureate in Physiology or Medicine.Faculty website at the University of ZurichMax Delbrück - Biographical at nobelprize.org Delbrück has a Bachelor's degree in physics and applied mathematics from the University of California, San Diego and obtained a PhD in computation and neural systems at Caltech in 1993 under the guidance of Carver Mead. == References == Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:American bioengineers Category:American computer scientists Category:American neuroscientists Category:American expatriates in Switzerland Category:Fellow Members of the IEEE Category:ETH Zurich faculty Category:University of Zurich faculty Category:California Institute of Technology alumni Category:University of California, San Diego alumni Category:People from Pasadena, California
